How to watch
Golf fans can watch the first two days of the Masters on Masters.com, the Masters app, ESPN+ and Paramout+.

Past champions
2021: Hideki Matsuyama
2020: Dustin Johnson
2019: Tiger Woods
2018: Patrick Reed
2017: Sergio Garcia
2016: Danny Willett
2015: Jordan Spieth
2014: Bubba Watson
2013: Adam Scott
2012: Bubba Watson
2011: Charl Schwartzel
2010: Phil Mickelson
Tee times and pairings (ET)
(Kevin C. Cox/Getty Images)
Bad weather pushed the start of the first round backward.

This year’s tournament will be as intriguing as ever as Tiger Woods said earlier in the week he intends on playing more than a year after suffering devastating leg injuries in a Los Angeles car crash.
Woods hasn’t competed in the Masters since 2020 – the last event in which he faced high-level competition.
TV coverage of the first two rounds on ESPN won’t begin until around 3 p.m.
Woods added he believes he could win the green jacket again as well.
The 86th edition of the Masters is set to tee off Thursday morning.
He competed in the PNC Championship in 2021 with his son, Charlie.
Ryan Gaydos is the sports editor for Fox News and Fox Business.
CBS’ TV coverage will begin Saturday will also start at 3 p.m.
Xander Schauffele and Jordan Spieth lost by three strokes.
The Masters is the premier event of the golf season.
Hideki Matsuyama is the defending Masters champion.
Here’s what to know about this year’s tournament.
Story tips can be sent to Ryan.Gaydos@fox.com.
He beat out Will Zalatoris by one stroke.
